title: Speficic Purposes
subtitle: Business
lessonDescription: Donna calls Marina to tell her the good news she got the job. Marina wisely decides to negotiate for higher salary.

paragraphs.speaker: Donna:
paragraphs.text: Marina, it's Donna Harris from Amrican Steel Enterprises. I've got great news. We'd like to make you an offer.

paragraphs.speaker: Donna:
paragraphs.text: Our HR department will go over the nitty-gritty of the offer with you, but let me give you the big picture now. The base salary will be $45,000.

paragraphs.speaker: Marina:
paragraphs.text: I'm really excited about this opportunity. I should mention that I'm wighing another offer with a higher base salary. Is there any room to negotiate?

paragraphs.speaker: Donna:
paragraphs.text: What did you have in mind?

paragraphs.speaker: Marina:
paragraphs.text: Well, my other offer is for $50,000. Can you match it?

paragraphs.speaker: Donna:
paragraphs.text: That's out of range. Let's slpit the difference. We'll go up to $4747,500.

paragraphs.speaker: Donna:
paragraphs.text: No, I'm afraid not. Our final offer is $47,500

paragraphs.speaker: Marina:
paragraphs.text: This sounds good, but I'd like to sleep on it. Can I call you back tomorrow?

paragraphs.speaker: Yes, but please touch base with me first thing in the morning so we can get the ball rolling. We've got several other candidates interested in the position
Marina:
paragraphs.text: Donna, I've had a chance to review your offer. I'm going to stand my ground. To acceprt your offer, I really need $48,000.

paragraphs.speaker: Donna:
paragraphs.text: Marina, you drive a hard bargain! But, okay, I think that can be arranged. Can you start on Monday, 9 a.m.?

paragraphs.speaker: Marina:
paragraphs.text: That'll be perfect. See you then!
